text.__SUMMARY__: Lithocarpus jacobsii is a tree in the beech family Fagaceae. It is named for the Dutch botanist Marius Jacobs.
text.Description: Lithocarpus jacobsii grows as a tree up to 36 metres (120 ft) tall with a trunk diameter of up to 60 cm (24 in). The brown bark is smooth or lenticellate. Its coriaceous leaves measure up to 56 cm (22 in) long. The brown acorns are ovoid to roundish and measure up to 2.8 cm (1 in) across.
text.Distribution and habitat:
Lithocarpus jacobsii is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is mixed dipterocarp to lower montane forests up to 1,300 m (4,000 ft) altitude.
